items.label: 1a
items.title: Question 1a
prompt: The diagram shows a human sperm cell. (a) What is the maximum number of X chromosomes found in the nucleus of a sperm cell? A 0 B C D

items.label: 1b
items.title: Question 1b
prompt: (b) The middle piece of the sperm cell contains mitochondria. Explain the function of these mitochondria.

items.label: 1c
items.title: Question 1c
prompt: (c) The acrosome contains digestive enzymes. Suggest the function of the acrosome.

items.label: 1d
items.title: Question 1d
prompt: (d) Describe the route taken by a sperm cell from when it enters the woman’s body to the site of fertilisation of the egg. Total for Question = 7 marks

items.label: 2a
items.title: Question 2a
prompt: The diagram shows a food chain from a lake. (a) Name the primary consumer in this food chain.

items.label: 2b
items.title: Question 2b
prompt: (b) The microscopic plants convert light energy into chemical energy.

items.label: 2i

prompt: (i) Describe the process that converts light energy into chemical energy.

items.label: 2i(ii)

prompt: (ii) Give two reasons why some of the energy in the microscopic plants is not transferred to the small fish.

items.label: 2c
items.title: Question 2c
prompt: (c) The birds do not have teeth. The fish they eat is initially crushed in part of their digestive system called a gizzard. Suggest why crushing the fish in the gizzard helps the birds to digest the fish. Total for Question = 8 marks

items.label: 3a
items.title: Question 3a
prompt: The diagram shows the human circulation system with some blood vessels labelled A to J. (a) The table gives some statements about the content of blood vessels in this circulation system.

items.label: 3i
items.title: Question 3i
prompt: (i) Complete the table by giving the letter of the blood vessel that matches each statement. (5) Statement Letter contains the least carbon dioxide contains the most glucose after a meal contains the least oxygen contains the least urea contains blood at the highest pressure

items.label: 3i(ii)
items.title: Question 3i(ii)
prompt: (ii) State two ways in which the structure of blood vessel A differs from the structure of blood vessel J.

items.label: 3b
items.title: Question 3b
prompt: (b) Muscles in the legs contain capillaries. A scientist investigates how long‑term training affects the number of capillaries in an athlete’s leg muscles. The scientist determines the mean number of capillaries per mm2 in samples of leg muscle from the athlete before and after a period of training. The table shows the scientist’s results. Mean number of Muscle sample capillaries per mm2 before training 313 after training 349 The scientist concludes that training improves the athletic performance. Discuss this conclusion. (5) Total for Question = 12 marks

items.label: 4b
items.title: Question 4b
prompt: (a) The table gives some examples of biological processes. (b) Zinc is poisonous to many plants and can affect natural selection. A scientist investigates the ability of one grass species to survive at different distances from a zinc mine. The scientist uses a sampling method to measure the percentage cover of this grass species at different distances from the zinc mine. The graph shows the scientist’s results. 100 80 60 Percentage cover (%) 40 20 0 0 50 100 150 200 Distance from mine in metres

options.text: scientist investigates the ability of one grass species to survive at different

items.label: 4i
items.title: Question 4i
prompt: (i) The zinc concentration in soil is higher near the zinc mine than it is further from the zinc mine. Explain how natural selection could be responsible for the results shown in the graph between 0 and 100 metres. (4)

items.label: 4i(ii)
items.title: Question 4i(ii)
prompt: (ii) Describe a method the scientist could use to compare the population size of the grass species at 50 metres and 100 metres from the mine. (4) Total for Question 4 = 11 marks

items.label: 5a

items.label: 5c

items.label: 5e

items.label: 6a
items.title: Question 6a
prompt: Neurones transmit nerve impulses. (a) This neurone is involved in the withdrawal reflex of a finger from a hot object. The neurone transmits electrical impulses from the central nervous system to the effector.

items.label: 6i

items.label: 6i(ii)

items.label: 6i(ii)(iii)
items.title: Question 6i(ii)(iii)
prompt: (iii) Explain the advantage of a withdrawal reflex when a finger touches a hot object.

items.label: 6b
items.title: Question 6b
prompt: (b) Some neurones do not have a myelin sheath. A scientist investigates the impulse speed for neurones with different diameters. She does this for neurones with a myelin sheath and neurones without a myelin sheath. The graph shows the scientist’s results. 8 myelin sheath 6 Impulse speed 4 in m per s no myelin sheath 0 0 4 Diameter of neurone in μm

items.label: 6i
items.title: Question 6i
prompt: (i) Which conclusion is supported by the graph? A impulses are always faster in neurones with a myelin sheath B neurones always have a myelin sheath C wider neurones have a myelin sheath D wider neurones have faster impulses

options.text: impulses are always faster in neurones with a myelin sheath
neurones always have a myelin sheath
wider neurones have a myelin sheath

prompt: (iii) The neurone is 90 cm long. Calculate the time taken for an impulse to travel along this neurone. Give your answer in standard form. time = s Total for Question 6 = 9 marks

items.label: 7a
items.title: Question 7a
prompt: Scientists investigate the effect of salt (NaCl) concentration on the germination of maize seeds. Batches of seeds are watered with different concentrations of salt solution. They count the number of seeds that germinate in each batch 12 days after sowing. They then determined the percentage germination. (a) (i) Describe how the scientists could tell if a maize seed had germinated.

items.label: 7i(ii)
items.title: Question 7i(ii)
prompt: (ii) Explain the effect of increasing the concentration of salt solution on germination. (4)

items.label: Q11
items.title: Question Q11
prompt: Bread can be produced from flour using yeast. Design an investigation to find out if changing the starch content of the flour causes the bread to expand more. Your answer should include experimental details and be written in full sentences. (6)
